text:
도토리를 검색하자 어머니가 말한 교양 방송의 클래식 도토리라는 프로그램이 떴다. 해원이 저를 떠난 게 벌써 보름째였고, 방송은 나흘 전이었다.
찾고자 하면 어디에 있는지 알아내는 것은 일도 아니다. 그러나 우진은 그렇게 하지 않았다. 그에게 끌려가는 모습으로 보이고 싶지 않았다. 주도권은 언제나 제게 있어야 했다.
우진이 저지른 짓에 마음 상해 잠수를 타 버렸다고 해도 저를 사랑하는 해원은 무언가를 견디어 내는 인내력이 매우 저조했다. 충동적이고 감정적인 인간이었다. 결국에는 울면서 돌아올 거라고, 그리고 그렇게 만들 거라고 우진은 적당한 시기를 기다리는 중이었다.
그런데 저 보란 듯이 방송에 출연했다. 우진이 하지 말라고 부탁한 일이었다.
누가 해원을 보는 게 싫었다. 검찰청 구내식당의 커다란 벽걸이 화면으로 해원을 봤을 때 느꼈던 가슴의 통증, 갑자기 심장이 쿵 하고 내려앉으며 해원을 제외하고는 주변의 어떤 것도 의식할 수 없었던 그 망아의 상태를 저 말고 다른 누군가가 느끼게 된다는 것 자체가 싫었다. 그런 일은 용납할 수 없었다.
trans:
When he searched for acorns, a program called Classic Acorn, the cultural broadcast his mother had mentioned, came up. It had aired four days ago, on the 15th day since Haewon left me.
Finding out where she was wouldn’t have been difficult if he’d really wanted to. But Woo-jin didn’t do that. He refused to look like he was being led by her. The upper hand always had to be him.
Even if Haewon had disappeared because she was hurt by Woojin’s actions, she wasn’t the kind of person who could hold out for long. She was an impulsive and emotional person. Woojin was sure Haewon would eventually come crawling back in tears—and was waiting for that moment.
But there she was, showing up on a broadcast like it was some grand gesture meant for him. It was something Woojin had asked her not to do.
He hated the idea of anyone seeing Haewon. He hated how his chest tightened painfully at seeing her on the massive wall-mounted screen in the prosecutor's office cafeteria. He hated the thought that anyone other than him might feel that overwhelming sense of emptiness, the way his heart would suddenly drop and he couldn’t focus on anything but Haewon.  Feeling like that was unacceptable. He couldn’t allow it.
